channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: You can now schedule ChatGPT to perform actions in the future, like setting reminders or getting weekly personalized news briefings
item.description: OpenAI president Greg Brockman says the company is doubling down on AI “agents” in 2025.

item.title: Banning phones in schools is now getting support from both red and blue states alike: ‘We have not done our job as grown-ups’
item.description: At least eight states have banned phone usage over the past two years, and proposals are being considered in several more states this year.

item.title: UnitedHealth says blame drugmakers for high costs, not 'middlemen'
Block agrees to pay $120 million in refunds to resolve Cash App fraud
item.description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau announced the order on Thursday in the waning days of the Biden administration.

item.title: How much lumber Southern California will need to rebuild after the wildfires
Mortgage rates rise past a key mark, signaling bad news for home buyers
Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser is still committed to her $1 billion efficiency push: ‘The best is still ahead’
item.description: Citigroup beat earnings expectations, posting a profit in the fourth quarter with a net income of $2.86 billion.

item.title: Generation Z investors are shifting to a conservative approach in 2025
Fund manager targeting Nike and Starbucks says DEI’s demise has been exaggerated
TikTok’s CEO is planning to attend Trump’s inauguration. He’ll see Elon Musk, Mark Zuckerberg, and Jeff Bezos
item.description: Donald Trump’s inauguration is a day after a ban on the app could take effect.
